children.name: Duration Encoded along Timelines
children.description: Data marks can encode duration along timelines, (implies the existence of a timeline axis).

children.name: Duration-encoding marks
children.description: Marks that encode duration.

children.name: Bars
children.description: Rectangles/Lines encoding time by length.

children.name: Height encoded
children.description: The height of the bar is utilized to encode something else.

children.name: Height unencoded
children.description: The height of the bar is NOT utilized to encode something else.

children.name: Extruded Ticks
children.description: Any form of intended tick mark where extruded part encodes duration.

children.name: Areas
children.description: Sparkline-style area chart where one axis encodes duration. The area can encode something else.

children.name: Springs
children.description: Spring-line or wave-like marks. Period may encode something else.

children.name: Time axis
children.description: There exists a time axis.

children.name: Orientation
children.description: The orientation/direction of the time axis.

children.name: Horizontal
children.description: Time axis is generally horizontal.

children.name: Spiral
children.description: Time axis is a spiral.

children.name: Time type
children.description: Meaning of time represented on the axis.

children.name: Physical Time
children.description: Represents a physically measured, often continous time.

children.name: Derived Time
children.description: Represents a derived form of time, such as logical time.

children.name: Cross-track Dependencies
children.description: Can have dependencies between data blocks or tracks.

children.name: Connection (lines)
children.description: Dependencies displayed with lines connecting two marks.

children.name: Arrows
children.description: Arrowheads are present on connective lines to indcate direction.

children.name: Edge bundling
children.description: Connection lines may use the node-link diagram technique of edge bundling.

children.name: Width
children.description: Width indicates something intrinsic to the dependency, such as direction.

children.name: Position
children.description: Dependencies are indicated SOLELY by the relative position of marks. Must indicate dependency beyond track hierarchy.

children.name: Adjacency
children.description: Depedencies between marks are indicated via adjacency. Must indicate dependency beyond track hierarchy.

children.name: Constraints
children.description: Dependencies between marks are indicated via a layout constraint. Must indicate depednency beyond track hierarchy.

children.name: Colors
children.description: Dependencies are indicated by color.

children.name: Color Hues
children.description: Dependency indicated by matching mark colors.

children.name: Gradient
children.description: Color gradient indicates dependency information, such as saturation indicating parent-child relationships.

children.name: Discrete Tracks
children.description: Has one axis with discrete tracks, partitioning data marks.

children.name: Hierarchy
children.description: How tracks form hierarchy in relation to each other.

children.name: 1-level
children.description: There is no hierarchy between tracks.

children.name: multi-level
children.description: The tracks are organized in a multi-level hierarchy.

children.name: parallel
children.description: Tracks with hierarchical relationships are shown parallel to each other.

children.name: icicle
children.description: Hierarchy shown in icicle-plot type layout, often with child tasks offset to indicate their relationship.

children.name: containment
children.description: Hierarchy shown using containment, where child tasks are contained by their parent's track.

children.name: categorical
children.description: Containment uses categorical encodings to differentiate tracks.

children.name: depth-encoded
children.description: Containment uses some form of depth-encoding to differentiate tracks.

children.name: Arrangement
children.description: How tracks are arranged in relation to each other.

children.name: Grid
children.description: Tracks are laid out in a separated fashion.

children.name: Time-Orthogonal
children.description: Tracks are arranged orthogonal to time axis.

children.name: TO-Arbitrary
children.description: Order of tracks is arbitrary or otherwise unknown.

children.name: TO-Sorted
children.description: Order of tracks is sorted in some discernable fashion.

children.name: TO-Derived
children.description: Order of tracks has been derived from the data.

children.name: TO-initial start
children.description: Tracks are organized in order of their first event.

children.name: TO-highest time span
children.description: Tracks are organized in order of which has the longest time span overall.

children.name: TO-Intrinsic
children.description: Order of tracks is intrinsic to the data.

children.name: TO-Alphabetical
children.description: Tracks are ordered alphabetically by some ID/name attribute.

children.name: TO-ID
children.description: Tracks are ordered by some ID attribute.

children.name: TO-Mixed
children.descripton: Tracks are ordered using several indicators.

children.name: 2D
children.description: Track arrangement uses 2D space.

children.name: 2D-Arbitrary
children.description: Arrangement of tracks is arbitrary or otherwise unknown.

children.name: 2D-Sorted
children.description: Arrangement of tracks is sorted in some discernable fashion.

children.name: 2D-Derived
children.description: Arrangement of tracks has been derived from the data.

children.name: 2D-initial start
children.description: Tracks are organized in order of their first event.

children.name: 2D-highest time span
children.description: Tracks are organized in order of which has the longest time span overall.

children.name: 2D-Intrinsic
children.description: Arrangement of tracks is intrinsic to the data.

children.name: 2D-Alphabetical
children.description: Tracks are ordered alphabetically by some ID/name attribute.

children.name: 2D-ID
children.description: Tracks are ordered by some ID attribute.

children.name: 2D-Geographical
children.description: Tracks are placed by geographical attributes.

children.name: 2D-Mixed
children.descripton: Tracks are ordered using several indicators.

children.name: 2D-Circular
children.description: Tracks are arranged in a circular fashion.

children.name: Space-filling
children.description: Tracks are laid out in a space-filling/packed manner.

children.name: Size distribution
children.description: How tracks are distributed in terms of space size.

children.name: equal
children.description: Tracks are afforded equal space within the visualization.

children.name: varied
children.description: Tracks are afforded unequal space in the visualization.
